An intern encrypted a flag with RSA, mistakenly leaking half the private key's bits. Can you recover the message? Ciphertext: 8882782788756063443468577850937605031251776495064263572236395402944354699004897087983365799168103829165123463359033694848318732999645936166624342731620260

The flag format is flag{...}
n=10481151822217193198385184291350066176986107164101859464473083256298513617916543713829222575509414905789786966268203330563053240935254104872949070193446431, e=7096269864652965832574541527198692279472727741810498055179955994772878104881684076621214523821443955505226690544808678233145816709987589096571148922911559, partial_p=17360149805752580458

---

## Challenge Technical Details
flag: flag{e1vifuhh}
cipher: RSA
ciphertext: 8882782788756063443468577850937605031251776495064263572236395402944354699004897087983365799168103829165123463359033694848318732999645936166624342731620260
vulnerability: partial key exposure
hint: A partial exposure of a prime number's bits can significantly weaken RSA security. Look into lattice-based techniques like Coppersmith's attack.
necessary_info: The flag format is flag{...}
n=10481151822217193198385184291350066176986107164101859464473083256298513617916543713829222575509414905789786966268203330563053240935254104872949070193446431, e=7096269864652965832574541527198692279472727741810498055179955994772878104881684076621214523821443955505226690544808678233145816709987589096571148922911559, partial_p=17360149805752580458
extra_info: p=108971426472262271765038777595976539170603762257763125695702719461079633429451, q=96182569702206102420116454210223032321517682415512834736195480338211446905981, Ï†(n)=10481151822217193198385184291350066176986107164101859464473083256298513617916338559833048107135229750557980766696711209118379964974822206673149779113111000
subtype: partial_key_exposure
archetype: rsa
